maction.name: maction
maction.summary: The MathML `<maction>` element provides a possibility to bind actions to (sub-) expressions. The action itself is specified by the `actiontype` attribute, which accepts several values. To specify which child elements are addressed by the action, you can make use of the `selection` attribute.

actiontype.name: actiontype
actiontype.summary: The action which specifies what happens for this element. Possible values are.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color and also the fraction line color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

selection.name: selection
selection.summary: The child element which is addressed by the action. The default value is `1`, which is the first child element.

math.name: math
math.summary: The top-level element in MathML is `<math>`. Every valid MathML instance must be wrapped in `<math>` tags. In addition you must not nest a second `<math>` element in another, but you can have an arbitrary number of other child elements in it.

dir.name: dir
dir.summary: Overall directionality of formulas. Possible values are either `ltr` (left to right) or `rtl` (right to left).

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

display.name: display
display.summary: This enumerated attribute specifies how the enclosed MathML markup should be rendered

mode.name: mode
mode.summary: Deprecated in favor of the display attribute.

menclose.name: menclose
menclose.summary: The MathML `<menclose>` element renders its content inside an enclosing notation specified by the `notation` attribute.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

notation.name: notation
notation.summary: A list of notations, separated by white space, to apply to the child elements. The symbols are each drawn as if the others are not present, and therefore may overlap. Possible values are.

merror.name: merror
merror.summary: The MathML `<merror>` element is used to display contents as error messages. In Firefox this error message is rendered similar to the typical XML error message. Note that this error is not thrown when your MathML markup is wrong or not well-formed XML. You will still get an XML parsing error (in case of the XHTML notation of MathML), which has nothing to do with `<merror>`.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color and also the fraction line color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mfenced.name: mfenced
mfenced.summary: The deprecated MathML `<mfenced>` element used to provide the possibility to add custom opening and closing parentheses (such as brackets) and separators (such as commas or semicolons) to an expression. It has been removed from the latest MathML standard and modern browsers no longer support it. Use the mrow and mo elements instead.

close.name: close
close.summary: A string for the closing delimiter. The default value is `")`" and any white space is trimmed.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color and also the fraction line color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

open.name: open
open.summary: A string for the opening delimiter. The default value is `"("` and any white space is trimmed.

separators.name: separators
separators.summary: A sequence of zero or more characters to be used for different separators, optionally divided by white space, which is ignored. The default value is ",". By specifying more than one character, it is possible to set different separators for each argument in the expression. If there are too many separators, all excess is ignored. If there are too few separators in the expression, the last specified separator is repeated.

mfrac.name: mfrac
mfrac.summary: The MathML `<mfrac>` element is used to display fractions.

bevelled.name: bevelled
bevelled.summary: Specifies the way the fraction is displayed. If `true`, the fraction line is bevelled, which means that numerator and denominator are displayed side by side and separated by a slash (/). Otherwise, if set to `false` (which is the default value), numerator and denominator are on top of each other.

denomalign.name: denomalign
denomalign.summary: The alignment of the denominator under the fraction. Possible values are: `left`, `center` (default), and `right`.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

linethickness.name: linethickness
linethickness.summary: The thickness of the horizontal fraction line. This attributes accepts any length values.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color and also the fraction line color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

numalign.name: numalign
numalign.summary: The alignment of the numerator over the fraction. Possible values are: `left`, `center` (default), and `right`.

mi.name: mi
mi.summary: The MathML `<mi>` element indicates that the content should be rendered as an identifier such as function names, variables or symbolic constants. You can also have arbitrary text in it to mark up terms.

dir.name: dir
dir.summary: The text direction. Possible values are either `ltr` (left to right) or `rtl` (right to left).

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathsize.name: mathsize
mathsize.summary: The size of the content. See length for possible values.

mathvariant.name: mathvariant
mathvariant.summary: This logical class of the identifier, which varies in typography. That is, although the names suggest the typographic style for the class, semantically, items with the same class are treated "the same" within an expression, which might or might not involve displaying them with the named typography. The following values are allowed.

mmultiscripts.name: mmultiscripts
mmultiscripts.summary: The MathML `<mmultiscripts>` element allows you to create tensor-like objects. In a descriptive way tensors are multidimensional matrices (mathematical imprecise but exemplified). The degree of a tensor depends on the dimensionality of a representative array. For example, a number is a 0-dimensional array, or a 0th-order tensor. A 1-dimensional array (e.g. vectors) is a 1st-order tensor and so 2nd-order tensors are needed to represent square matrices. To learn more about the mathematical background of tensors refer to the entry on Wikipedia.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

subscriptshift.name: subscriptshift
subscriptshift.summary: The minimum space by which to shift the subscript below the baseline of the expression, as a CSS length.

superscriptshift.name: superscriptshift
superscriptshift.summary: The minimum space by which to shift the superscript above the baseline of the expression, as a CSS length.

mn.name: mn
mn.summary: The MathML `<mn>` element represents a numeric literal which is normally a sequence of digits with a possible separator (a dot or a comma). However, it is also allowed to have arbitrary text in it which is actually a numeric quantity, for example "eleven".

dir.name: dir
dir.summary: The text direction. Possible values are either `ltr` (left to right) or `rtl` (right to left).

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathsize.name: mathsize
mathsize.summary: The size of the content. See length for possible values.

mathvariant.name: mathvariant
mathvariant.summary: This attribute specifies the logical class of the number which varies in typography. That is, although the names suggest the typographic style for the class, semantically, items with the same class are treated "the same" within an expression, which might or might not involve displaying them with the named typography. The following values are allowed.

mo.name: mo
mo.summary: The MathML `<mo>` element represents an operator in a broad sense. Besides operators in strict mathematical meaning, this element also includes "operators" like parentheses, separators like comma and semicolon, or "absolute value" bars.

accent.name: accent
accent.summary: If the operator is used as an under- or overscript this attribute specifies whether the operator should be treated as an accent.

dir.name: dir
dir.summary: The text direction. Possible values are either `ltr` (left to right) or `rtl` (right to left).

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

fence.name: fence
fence.summary: There is no visual effect for this attribute, but it specifies whether the operator is a fence (such as parentheses).

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

lspace.name: lspace
lspace.summary: The amount of space before the operator (see length for values and units). The constant `thickmathspace` (5/18em) is the default value.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathsize.name: mathsize
mathsize.summary: The size of the content. See length for possible values.

mathvariant.name: mathvariant
mathvariant.summary: This attribute specifies the logical class of the operator which varies in typography. That is, although the names suggest the typographic style for the class, semantically, items with the same class are treated "the same" within an expression, which might or might not involve displaying them with the named typography. The following values are allowed.

mover.name: mover
mover.summary: The MathML `<mover>` element is used to attach an accent or a limit over an expression. Use the following syntax: `<mover> base overscript </mover>`

accent.name: accent
accent.summary: If `true` the over-script is an accent, which is drawn closer to the base expression.

align.name: align
align.summary: The alignment of the over-script. Possible values are: `left`, `center`, and `right`.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mpadded.name: mpadded
mpadded.summary: The MathML `<mpadded>` element is used to add extra padding and to set the general adjustment of position and size of enclosed contents.

depth.name: depth
depth.summary: Sets or increments the depth. Possible values: Any length or an increment/decrement (a length prefixed with "+" or "-") .

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

height.name: height
height.summary: Sets or increments the height. Possible values: Any length or an increment/decrement (a length prefixed with "+" or "-") .

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

lspace.name: lspace
lspace.summary: Sets or increments the horizontal position. Possible values: Any length or an increment/decrement (a length prefixed with "+" or "-") .

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

voffset.name: voffset
voffset.summary: Sets or increments the vertical position. Possible values: Any length or an increment/decrement (a length prefixed with "+" or "-") .

width.name: width
width.summary: Sets or increments the width. Possible values: Any length or an increment/decrement (a length prefixed with "+" or "-") .

mphantom.name: mphantom
mphantom.summary: The MathML `<mphantom>` element is rendered invisibly, but dimensions (such as height, width, and baseline position) are still kept.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mroot.name: mroot
mroot.summary: The MathML `<mroot>` element is used to display roots with an explicit index. Two arguments are accepted, which leads to the syntax: `<mroot> base index </mroot>`.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URL.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color and also the color of the root symbol itself. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mrow.name: mrow
mrow.summary: The MathML `<mrow>` element is used to group sub-expressions, which usually contain one or more operators with their respective operands (such as mi and mn). This element renders as a horizontal row containing its arguments.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

dir.name: dir
dir.summary: Overall directionality of formulas. Possible values are either `ltr` (left to right) or `rtl` (right to left).

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

ms.name: ms
ms.summary: The MathML `<ms>` element represents a string literal meant to be interpreted by programming languages and computer algebra systems. By default, string literals are displayed as enclosed by double quotes (`"`); by using the `lquote` and `rquote` attributes, you can set custom characters to display. Note that quotation marks should not be specified unless they are part of the string literal. The content of an `<ms>` element is not an ASCII string per se, but rather a sequence of characters and malignmark elements.

dir.name: dir
dir.summary: The text direction. Possible values are either `ltr` (left to right) or `rtl` (right to left).

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

lquote.name: lquote
lquote.summary: The opening quote character (depends on `dir`) to enclose the content. The default value is "`"".`

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathsize.name: mathsize
mathsize.summary: The size of the content. See length for possible values.

mathvariant.name: mathvariant
mathvariant.summary: This attribute specifies the logical class of the identifier, which varies in typography. That is, although the names suggest the typographic style for the class, semantically, items with the same class are treated "the same" within an expression, which might or might not involve displaying them with the named typography. The following values are allowed.

mspace.name: mspace
mspace.summary: The MathML `<mspace>` element is used to display a blank space, whose size is set by its attributes.

depth.name: depth
depth.summary: The desired depth (below the baseline) of the space (see length for values and units).

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

height.name: height
height.summary: The desired height (above the baseline) of the space (see length for values and units).

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

width.name: width
width.summary: The desired width of the space (see length for values and units).

msqrt.name: msqrt
msqrt.summary: The MathML `<msqrt>` element is used to display square roots (no index is displayed). The square root accepts only one argument, which leads to the following syntax: `<msqrt> base </msqrt>`.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color and also the color of the root symbol itself. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mstyle.name: mstyle
mstyle.summary: The MathML `<mstyle>` element is used change the style of its children. It accepts all attributes of all MathML presentation elements with some exceptions and additional attributes listed below.

dir.name: dir
dir.summary: Overall directionality of formulas. Possible values are either `ltr` (left to right) or `rtl` (right to left).

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

infixlinebreakstyle.name: infixlinebreakstyle
infixlinebreakstyle.summary: Specifies the default `linebreakstyle` to use for infix operators. The values `before`, `after` and `duplicate` are allowed.

scriptlevel.name: scriptlevel
scriptlevel.summary: Controls mostly the font-size. The higher the `scriptlevel`, the smaller the font size. This attribute accepts a non-negative integer, as well as a "+" or a "-" sign, which increments or decrements the current value. In addition, the `scriptlevel` attribute can never reduce the font size below `scriptminsize` in order to avoid unreadable small font sizes and depends on the multiplier specified in `scriptsizemultiplier`.

scriptminsize.name: scriptminsize
scriptminsize.summary: Specifies a minimum font size allowed due to changes in `scriptlevel`. The default value is 8pt.

scriptsizemultiplier.name: scriptsizemultiplier
scriptsizemultiplier.summary: Specifies the multiplier to be used to adjust font size due to changes in `scriptlevel`. The default value is 0.71.

msub.name: msub
msub.summary: The MathML `<msub>` element is used to attach a subscript to an expression.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

subscriptshift.name: subscriptshift
subscriptshift.summary: The minimum space by which to shift the subscript below the baseline of the expression, as a length value.

msubsup.name: msubsup
msubsup.summary: The MathML `<msubsup>` element is used to attach both a subscript and a superscript, together, to an expression.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

subscriptshift.name: subscriptshift
subscriptshift.summary: The minimum space by which to shift the subscript below the baseline of the expression, as a length value.

superscriptshift.name: superscriptshift
superscriptshift.summary: The minimum space by which to shift the superscript above the baseline of the expression, as a length value.

msup.name: msup
msup.summary: The MathML `<msup>` element is used to attach a superscript to an expression.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

superscriptshift.name: superscriptshift
superscriptshift.summary: The minimum space by which to shift the superscript up from the baseline of the expression, as a length value.

mtable.name: mtable
mtable.summary: The MathML `<mtable>` element allows you to create tables or matrices. Inside a `<mtable>` only mtr and mtd elements may appear. These elements are similar to table , tr and td elements of HTML.

align.name: align
align.summary: Specifies the vertical alignment of the table with respect to its environment.

columnalign.name: columnalign
columnalign.summary: Specifies the horizontal alignment of the cells. Multiple values separated by space are allowed and apply to the corresponding columns (e.g. `columnalign="left right center"`). Possible values are: `left`, `center` (default) and `right`.

columnlines.name: columnlines
columnlines.summary: Specifies column borders. Multiple values separated by space are allowed and apply to the corresponding columns (e.g. `columnlines="none none solid"`). Possible values are: `none` (default), `solid` and `dashed`.

columnspacing.name: columnspacing
columnspacing.summary: Specifies the space between table columns.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`.

frame.name: frame
frame.summary: Specifies borders of the entire table. Possible values are: `none` (default), `solid` and `dashed`.

framespacing.name: framespacing
framespacing.summary: Specifies additional space added between the table and frame.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

rowalign.name: rowalign
rowalign.summary: Specifies the vertical alignment of the cells. Multiple values separated by space are allowed and apply to the corresponding rows (e.g. `rowalign="top bottom axis"`). Possible values are: `axis`, `baseline` (default), `bottom`, `center` and `top`.

rowlines.name: rowlines
rowlines.summary: Specifies row borders. Multiple values separated by space are allowed and apply to the corresponding rows (e.g. `rowlines="none none solid"`). Possible values are: `none` (default), `solid` and `dashed`.

rowspacing.name: rowspacing
rowspacing.summary: Specifies the space between table rows.

width.name: width
width.summary: Specifies the width of the entire table. Accepts length values.

mtd.name: mtd
mtd.summary: The MathML `<mtd>` element represents a cell in a table or a matrix. It may only appear in a mtr element. This element is similar to the td element of HTML.

columnalign.name: columnalign
columnalign.summary: Specifies the horizontal alignment of this cell and overrides values specified by mtable or mtr.

columnspan.name: columnspan
columnspan.summary: A non-negative integer value that indicates on how many columns does the cell extend.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

rowalign.name: rowalign
rowalign.summary: Specifies the vertical alignment of this cell and overrides values specified by mtable or mtr.

rowspan.name: rowspan
rowspan.summary: A non-negative integer value that indicates on how many rows does the cell extend.

mtext.name: mtext
mtext.summary: The MathML <mtext> element is used to render arbitrary text with no notational meaning, such as comments or annotations.

dir.name: dir
dir.summary: The text direction. Possible values are either `ltr` (left to right) or `rtl` (right to left).

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathsize.name: mathsize
mathsize.summary: The size of the content. See length for possible values.

mathvariant.name: mathvariant
mathvariant.summary: This attribute specifies the logical class of the identifier, which varies in typography. That is, although the names suggest the typographic style for the class, semantically, items with the same class are treated "the same" within an expression, which might or might not involve displaying them with the named typography. The following values are allowed.

mtr.name: mtr
mtr.summary: The MathML `<mtr>` element represents a row in a table or a matrix. It may only appear in a mtable element. This element is similar to the tr element of HTML.

columnalign.name: columnalign
columnalign.summary: Overrides the horizontal alignment of cells specified by mtable for this row.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

rowalign.name: rowalign
rowalign.summary: Overrides the vertical alignment of cells specified by mtable for this row.

munder.name: munder
munder.summary: The MathML `<munder>` element is used to attach an accent or a limit under an expression. It uses the following syntax: `<munder> base underscript </munder>`

accentunder.name: accentunder
accentunder.summary: If `true`, the element is an accent, which is drawn closer to the base expression.

align.name: align
align.summary: The alignment of the underscript. Possible values are: `left`, `center`, and `right`.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

munderover.name: munderover
munderover.summary: The MathML `<munderover>` element is used to attach accents or limits both under and over an expression.

accent.name: accent
accent.summary: If `true`, the overscript is an accent, which is drawn closer to the base expression.

accentunder.name: accentunder
accentunder.summary: If `true`, the underscript is an accent, which is drawn closer to the base expression.

align.name: align
align.summary: The alignment of both underscript and overscript. Possible values are: `left`, `center`, and `right`.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

href.name: href
href.summary: Used to set a hyperlink to a specified URI.

mathbackground.name: mathbackground
mathbackground.summary: The background color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

mathcolor.name: mathcolor
mathcolor.summary: The text color. You can use `#rgb`, `#rrggbb` and HTML color names.

semantics.name: semantics
semantics.summary: In MathML there are two ways to mark up mathematics: Presentation MathML is used to control the layout of equations, whereas Content MathML is designed to encode the semantic mathematical meaning and to make expressions understandable to computer algebra systems. The MathML elements `<semantics>`, `<annotation>` and `<annotation-xml>` are used to combine presentation and content markup and to provide both, layout information and semantic meaning of mathematical expressions.

displaystyle.name: displaystyle
displaystyle.summary: A Boolean value specifying whether more vertical space is used for displayed equations or, if set to `false`, a more compact layout is used to display formulas. The main effect is that larger versions of operators are displayed, when `displaystyle` is set to `true`. See also `movablelimits` on mo.

encoding.name: encoding
encoding.summary: The encoding of the semantic information in the annotation (e.g. "MathML-Content", "MathML-Presentation", "application/openmath+xml", "image/png")

cd.name: cd
cd.summary: The content dictionary that contains the annotation key symbol.

name.name: name
name.summary: The name of the annotation key symbol.

src.name: src
src.summary: The location of an external source for semantic information.
